Detailed Description

Interface to the hardware Free Pool Allocator on Octeon chips.

These are the legacy models, i.e. prior to CN78XX/CN76XX.

Revision
120123

Function Documentation

static void* cvmx_fpa1_alloc ( cvmx_fpa1_pool_t  pool  )  [inline, static]
static void cvmx_fpa1_async_alloc ( uint64_t  scr_addr,
cvmx_fpa1_pool_t  pool 
) [inline, static]

Asynchronously get a new block from the FPA Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

The result of cvmx_fpa_async_alloc() may be retrieved using cvmx_fpa_async_alloc_finish().

Parameters:
scr_addr Local scratch address to put response in. This is a byte address but must be 8 byte aligned.
pool Pool to get the block from
static void* cvmx_fpa1_async_alloc_finish ( uint64_t  scr_addr,
cvmx_fpa1_pool_t  pool 
) [inline, static]

Retrieve the result of cvmx_fpa_async_alloc Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Parameters:
scr_addr The Local scratch address. Must be the same value passed to cvmx_fpa_async_alloc().
pool Pool the block came from. Must be the same value passed to cvmx_fpa_async_alloc.
Returns:
Pointer to the block or NULL on failure
static void cvmx_fpa1_disable ( void   )  [inline, static]

Reset FPA to disable.

Make sure buffers from all FPA pools are freed before disabling FPA.

static void cvmx_fpa1_enable ( void   )  [inline, static]

Enable the FPA for use.

Must be performed after any CSR configuration but before any other FPA functions.

Free the specified fpa pool.

Parameters:
pool Pool to free
Returns:
